intro: Caragana arborescens lusus angustifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf shrub willow, is a deciduous shrub native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features slender, often multi-branched stems that can grow up to 2 meters in height. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves that are typically 2–5 cm long and have a pointed tip. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, blooming in early spring before the leaves fully develop. This species is adapted to harsh environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
